channel.title: Homes on Ayman A. Amin
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Ayman A. Amin

item.description: About Me I am an Assistant Professor of Statistics at Faculty of Commerce, Menoufia University, Egypt, with a background on mathematics, theoretical statistics, Bayesian statistics, time series analysis, machine learning, software quality attributes forecasting and statistical programming, along with excellent academic and research experiences. I recieved my PhD degree from Faculty of Science, Engineering and Technology, Swinburne University of Technology, Australia (in January 2014), and my MSC in Statistics (with excellent degree in October 2009) and BSC in Statistics and Social Science Computing (with excellent degree in June 2006) from Faculty of Economics and Political Science (FEPS), Cairo University, Egypt.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I teach the following courses for undergraduate students: Applied Mathematics. Principles of Statistics. Applied Statistics. Quantitative Analysis. I teach the following courses for Postgraduate students: Advanced Statistics Theory of Statistics Mathematics for Statisticians Demography Time Series Analysis
